calculator

Class LetNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • calculator.Node
      • calculator.LetNode

  • public class LetNode
extends Node
    A special node subclass designed to handle let expressions. Contains the functions necessary to parse and replace variable names and values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LetNode()
      Calls the superclass constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      An abstract method that returns an integer.

      This function is used to help mark where the 3-tuple argument of a let function should be split.
      static java.lang.String replaceStr(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String target, java.lang.String replacement)
      A function that, given an input string, will tokenize the string in order to find the replaceable variables.
      static java.lang.String resolveLet(java.lang.String input)
      This function will take the body of a let expression (its arguments) and return the internal node with the desired substitutions in place.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Description copied from class: Node
        An abstract method that returns an integer. Implemented by different node classes.
        Specified by:
        getValue in class Node
        Returns:
        None

      • markSplits

        public static java.lang.String markSplits(java.lang.String tuple)
        This function is used to help mark where the 3-tuple argument of a let function should be split. It replaces all separating "," characters with "#" which are then used to split the string in the resolveLet() function.
        Parameters:
        tuple - A 3-tuple to have it's splitting comas marked.
        Returns:
        A 3-tuple with "#" indicating where it should be split.

      • resolveLet

        public static java.lang.String resolveLet(java.lang.String input)
        This function will take the body of a let expression (its arguments) and return the internal node with the desired substitutions in place.
        Parameters:
        input - The inner arguments of a let expression.
        Returns:
        The resultant expression with the let values substituted in.

      • replaceStr

        public static java.lang.String replaceStr(java.lang.String input,
                                          java.lang.String target,
                                          java.lang.String replacement)
        A function that, given an input string, will tokenize the string in order to find the replaceable variables. The second argument is the string to be replaced and the third argument is what you wish to replace it with.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be tokenized.
        target - - The string to be replaced in the input.
        replacement - - The replacement of the target
        Returns:
        A tokenized input with the replacement character/string
